title: ENS rises nearly 40% following Vitalik Buterin endorsement - crypto.news
summary: Vitalik Buterin endorses Ethereum Name Service (ENS), causing a 39% price surge. Buterin emphasizes the importance of trustless, Merkle-proof-based CCIP resolvers for Layer 2 (L2) solutions and stresses the need for ENS subdomains to be registrable, updateable, and readable directly on L2s. The price of ENS increases to $13.94, with a 24-hour trading volume of $313 million.

title: Solana NFT Sales Overtake Ethereum for the First Time Ever in December - Yahoo Finance
summary: Solana NFT sales surpassed Ethereum for the first time in December, with $366.5 million in sales compared to $353.2 million on Ethereum. Solana's sales volume increased despite flat Ethereum sales, with unique traders also rising on Solana. The surge in Solana's NFT sales can be attributed to the significant increase in the value of its native token, SOL, which has quadrupled in price over the past three months.

title: Does Ethereum's flash crash to $2K mean ETH's bullish momentum is gone? - Cointelegraph
summary: Ethereum's price dropped by 14% in a flash crash on January 3, falling from $2,380 to $2,050 in less than 2 hours. This price level had not been seen since December 1, 2023. The sudden correction led to the liquidation of $100 million worth of ETH long future contracts, which were leveraged bets on the price increase. Despite the price correction, the market remains healthy, at least from a derivatives perspective, with Ether options volume indicating reduced demand for protective strategies. However, the sudden flash crash has raised questions about the significance of the price correction and whether it signals the end of the bullish momentum for Ethereum.

title: Buterin's ETH Roadmap Highlights State of Progress - CCN.com
summary:
Vitalik Buterin has shared an updated Ethereum roadmap, highlighting plans for the platform's progress in 2024 and beyond. The roadmap reflects Ethereum's evolving needs and the current state of research and development. Key takeaways include:

* The Merge was a single event that occurred on September 15, 2022, linking the Ethereum mainnet with the proof-of-stake Beacon Chain consensus layer.
* The Merge is now seen as a more extensive change to Ethereum, encompassing network participants' collective adoption of a new consensus mechanism and the necessary changes to overcome current challenges.
* In 2023, the Shanghai/Capella upgrade enabled users to withdraw staked ETH for the first time.
* The next Proof-of-Stake milestone identified by Buterin is the development of single slot finality (SSF), which aims to reduce the number of 12-second slots it takes to finalize each transaction from between 64 and 95 to just one.

title: ERC-20 Token Standard Explained - LCX
summary: The ERC-20 token standard is a technical standard used on the Ethereum blockchain for smart contracts. It was proposed in 2015 by Fabian Vogelsteller and provides a common set of interfaces and functions that can be used by various token contracts. The standard facilitates the creation and deployment of tokens by ensuring interoperability and allowing them to be traded on Ethereum-based decentralized exchanges (DEXs). ERC-20 tokens are fungible, meaning they can be exchanged for other tokens of the same type and value. The standard specifies six required and three optional functions that developers must include in their smart contract code to create an ERC-20 token. These functions include total supply, balance of, transfer, approve, transfer from, and allowance. Developers can also add additional features to the contract code, such as time-based restrictions on token transfers or special incentive structures for early adopters. ERC-20 tokens require the Ethereum network to function, and sending an ERC-20 token from one address to another requires a small amount of ETH (in the form of gas fees) to cover

The broader goal of the acquisition is to make on-chain data easily accessible, driving mainstream blockchain adoption.
